intro: Prosopanche cocuccii, commonly known as the golden crown-beard, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
